main event: Ground-radar observation of a blue-white object resembling a meteor with a bright flash of light in Rialto, California on October 22, 1955.
interesting points: The observation lasted only 3 seconds, indicating a brief and sudden appearance of the object.
The report mentions the possibility of the object being a physical object such as a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena.
No sound was reported despite the visual sighting, raising questions about the nature of the object.
The document was exchanged among various Air Force commands, indicating the official interest in the UFO report.
There is no photographic evidence accompanying the report, leaving the visual observation as the primary source of information.
sighted object: blue-white object resembling a meteor with a bright flash of light
